item.title: Life in Ohio Podcast Episode 130 - Radical
item.description:
Today I give my thanks to the Ohio Linuxfest volunteers and my geeky friends who make going to OLF so much fun.  See ya next year!

I also read a quote out of Become a Better You: 7 Keys to Improving Your Life Every Day, by Joel Osteen.

I also share that I am part of Marla Taviano's Radical Readalong of Radical: Taking Back Your Faith from the American Dream by David Platt.

I also share a little bit of my thoughts on a recent sermon at Church by my friend Rob Faught and his wife Leah.

item.title: Please Digg Walmart Doing Away With Layaway
item.description:
Just found out today that Walmart is doing away with Layaway after this Christmas.  They claim that it doesn't get used and it costs too much.  What I want to know is how come I have to stand for 3-4 hours to wait to get my stuff every Christmas??  This Christmas, use Walmart Layaway for at least one of your purchases.  In fact, use it on a big ticket item like a Nintendo Wii or a HDTV.  Make Walmart see that Layaway IS used by using it.  In fact, use it as much as you can before November. 

Why do I care about this?  Well, not everyone wants to be up to their neck in debt.  Walmart Layaway is a important tool that you can use to stay out of debt.  I don't want a Walmart Credit card!  I don't want ANY credit cards (but realize that you have to have one or two for emergencies).

Please digg the story: http://www.digg.com/business_finance/Wal_Mart_to_end_its_layaway_program

item.title: Conflicted....
item.description: I have been secretly envying the Nokia 770 ever since it came out.  Now I am choosing to sell my iPaq, a hx2495, and I am feeling somewhat conflicted about purchasing a 770.  First off, the closest place that has them is CompUSA and even then they have limited quantities.  After I get it, there would be considerable hacking to get it to where I need it.  Maybe I should just do it.  I feel like I should support Open Source software, yet with CompUSA having the 770 only at one store (and sold out online) is there something better coming from Nokia or are the abandoning the platform?  The 770 sounds like it has promise, but it does have some issues like the choice they made to support RS-MMC/Mobile MMC, the slower processor and no USB hosting ability(well without hacking anyway).  Anyway, Linc, if your reading this, convince me on what I need to do! :D
